pantry.name: Pavlova
pantry.description: Named after the legendary Russian ballerina Anna Pavlova, this meringue-based dessert is known for its crisp exterior and soft, marshmallow-like interior. This cake is a cherished Christmas tradition particularly in Australia and New Zealand.
pantry.question: Which ingredients do you need to make the lovely Pavlova?

pantry.name: Rocky road
pantry.description: The origins of the rich and chewy Rocky Road are somewhat unclear, though it is believed to have originated in the US. Its popularity as a festive indulgence however is completely undisputed!
pantry.question: What ingredients does Rocky Road typically contain?

pantry.name: Gingerbread cookies
pantry.description: Gingerbread have ancient origins, dating back to 2400 BC (!) in Greece and evolving in China by the 10th century. By the late Middle Ages, versions emerged across Europe, with Germany and England among the early enthusiasts. The Swedish variant has been around since the 1300's, a particularly crunchy biscuit. Legend in Sweden has it that indulging in these crunchy treats can even make you a nicer person!
pantry.question: What ingredients do we need for this crunchylicious biscuit?

pantry.name: St Lucia Buns
pantry.description: In Sweden, St. Lucia Buns, also known as 'Lussekatter' or 'Lucia Cats', are a cherished part of the festive season. Typically enjoyed on December 13th, St. Lucia's Day, these yellow buns are a symbol of light and celebration.
pantry.question: What ingredients go into these yummy buns?

pantry.name: Cozonac cu ciocolata
pantry.description: In Romania, the tradition of savouring Cozonac during Christmas is a time-honoured and flavorful custom. Baked to perfection, it fills homes with a tempting aroma during the festive season!
pantry.question: Which ingredients are needed for this sweet swirly bread?

pantry.name: Bûche de Noël
pantry.description: The Bûche de Noël (or Yule Log Cake), mimics the appearance of a wooden log, and makes for a great centrepiece for the table, as well as a delicious conclusion to the Christmas feast! With its rich flavours and festive design, this cake embodies the spirit of joy and indulgence that defines French holiday celebrations.
pantry.question: What's needed for this edible log?

pantry.name: Christmas pudding
pantry.description: This beloved holiday dessert originated in mediaeval England. Evolving from a savoury, porridge-like dish, it transformed into the rich and spiced treat we know today, and has become a symbol of Christmas in the United Kingdom and beyond.
pantry.question: How to make cake AB?
